thread.title: Greek exit polls show top parties neck-and-neck
thread.title_full: Greek exit polls show top parties neck-and-neck | News24

author: news24.com
title: Greek exit polls show top parties neck-and-neck
text:
Athens - Initial Greek exit polls showed SYRIZA and New Democracy neck-and-neck in a snap election called by former prime minister Alexis Tsipras in mid-August, state broadcaster ERT reported on Sunday.
ERT polls showed left-wing SYRIZA garnering between 30 and 34% of the vote while New Democracy was expected to clinch between 28 and 32.5%. The results are short of an absolute majority for either party, meaning that a coalition government will likely be necessary.
Extremist right-wing party Golden Dawn was predicted to come in third place, with from 5.5 to 7% of the vote, followed by the Communist party KKE and centrist socialist party Pasok.
Observers said turnout was exceptionally low at ballot stations, indicating that after five years of belt-tightening measures during which the economy has lost a quarter of its value and three elections since the beginning of the year, Greece is weary of politicians' promises.
